page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The area around{Wickford}and Ramsden Bellhouse has been occupied since about 2000 B.C..When the{romans} arrived in the first century A.D. they encountered a tribe called the {Trinovantes.}The main area of the settlement was near the present day site of St.Catherine's Church.The first document mentioning{'Wicforda'} is dated 975 A.D..{'Wicfort'}is named in the Domesday book.The main landowners were{Sweyne}and{Bishop {Odo.}The population probably remained under 250 until the early 1800's.Little seems to have changed here until about 100 years ago.In 1889 the railway to Shenfield and London was built.Local farmland was then sold off for development in plots.Amenities were connected later.Most development has occurred since 1945.
